Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Mummy breast cover
Description: Trapezoid mummy breast cover with from top to bottom: a winged solar disc flanked by the two falcon heads of the wesekh-collar. A winged scarab. A mummification scene presided by Anubis holding a vase (two canopic jars under the bed) with Isis on the right and Nephthys on the left, both mummiform. The contours are black, the background yellow.
